[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Module dependency ordering] If one native module depends on another (e.g., reflect using result), does the registration order ensure proper initialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [SafeNativeBuilder lifecycle] The SafeNativeBuilder is passed to all make_all functions - can its state accumulate errors or become corrupted during registration? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Native function isolation] Can one misbehaving native function corrupt the state used by other natives, or are they properly isolated? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Gas context sharing] All natives share the same SafeNativeContext - can one native's gas charging affect another native's execution in unexpected ways? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Type argument validation] Do all registered natives properly validate their type arguments, or can some accept invalid type parameters causing type unsafety? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Incremental gas disabled] with_incremental_gas_charging(false) is set for all stdlib natives - what security implications does disabling incremental charging have? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Gas parameter consistency] Each native uses different gas parameters (BCS_*, HASH_*, VECTOR_*, etc.) - are these parameters consistently updated across network upgrades? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: bcs] [Partial gas charging] When BCS serialization fails, partial gas is charged before returning an error - can attackers exploit this to learn information through gas consumption patterns? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: vector] [Gas calculation discrepancy] move_range gas calculation counts moved elements multiple times - is this calibration still accurate after VM optimizations? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: string] [Per-byte vs per-char] String operations charge per-byte but operate on characters - can this discrepancy be exploited with multi-byte UTF-8 characters? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: vector] [Error code namespace] EINDEX_OUT_OF_BOUNDS=1 and EFEATURE_NOT_ENABLED=2 may collide with other module error codes - can this cause error handling confusion? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: bcs] [NFE_BCS_SERIALIZATION_FAILURE] This abort code is reused across multiple failure scenarios - can attackers distinguish between different failure types to leak information? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: string] [Generic abort code] native_sub_string uses 'abort_code: 1' with a TODO comment - is this temporary code in production and what are its security implications? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: mem] [error::unavailable()] The error::unavailable() wrapper is used for feature flags - does this provide enough context to diagnose feature flag mismatches? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: cmp] [InvariantViolation error] native_compare returns InvariantViolation for wrong argument count - should this crash the VM or just abort the transaction? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Type parameter forwarding] Each native receives ty_args array - is there validation that the number and kind of type arguments match the function signature? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: bcs] [Type layout caching] type_to_type_layout is called repeatedly - is there caching to prevent redundant expensive layout construction? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: reflect] [Dynamic type resolution] native_resolve performs runtime type resolution - can this bypass Move's static type checking and cause type unsafety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: bcs] [WithFields/WithTypes rejection] constant_serialized_size rejects WithFields/WithTypes layouts - why are these rejected and could they appear in legitimate scenarios? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: vector] [Generic element type] move_range works with generic type T - does it properly handle non-copyable resource types to prevent duplication? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: hash] [Digest determinism] SHA-256 and SHA-3 implementations must be deterministic - are there any platform-specific optimizations that could cause divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: cmp] [Value comparison order] Value::compare() must have consistent ordering across validators - can pointer addresses or memory layout affect comparison results? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: bcs] [Serialization canonicalization] Are BCS serializations canonical (unique for each value), or can multiple serializations represent the same value causing state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: string] [Unicode normalization] UTF-8 strings are not normalized - can two strings with different Unicode representations compare as unequal despite being visually identical? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Module: reflect] [Module resolution order] Does native_resolve produce deterministic results when multiple modules define functions with the same name? (High)
